Package networkObjects

Class NetworkIO

java.lang.Object
networkObjects.NetworkIO
public class NetworkIO
extends java.lang.Object
A class that manages all network connections and I/O.
Author:
Yehoshua Halle

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    NetworkIO​(processing.core.PApplet parent, int serverPort)
    Constructs a new NetworkIO object with the default buffer size of 8192 (a bit over 8mb).
    NetworkIO​(processing.core.PApplet parent, int serverPort, boolean findPublicIP)  
    NetworkIO​(processing.core.PApplet parent, int serverPort, int bufferSizeInBytes)
    Constructs a new NetworkIO object with all buffer sizes being initialized to the one provided here.
    NetworkIO​(processing.core.PApplet parent, int serverPort, int bufferSizeInBytes, boolean findPublicIP)  
    NetworkIO​(processing.core.PApplet parent, int serverPort, int serverBufferSizeInBytes, int clientBufferSizeInBytes, boolean findPublicIP)
    Constructs a new NetworkIO object with a custom buffer size.

    T    		 pollFirstInstanceOf​(T target, java.util.LinkedList<Packet> queue)
    Searches for the first instance of a packet in a client's queue, then removes it.
    void putInClientEvent​(processing.net.Client c)
    If you want to use the built-in server and clients to their full capacity, put this in the clientEvent() method like this: public void clientEvent(Client c) { NetIO.putInClientEvent(c); }
    void putInDisconnectEvent​(processing.net.Client oldClient)
    If you want to use the built-in server to its full capacity, put this in the disconnectEvent() method like this: public void disconnectEvent(Client c) { NetIO.putInDisconnectEvent(c); } You need to do this to prevent data from being sent to disconnected clients.
    void putInServerEvent​(processing.net.Server ref, processing.net.Client newClient)
    If you want to use the built-in server to its full capacity, put this in the serverEvent() method like this: public void serverEvent(Server s, Client c) { NetIO.putInServerEvent(s, c); } This allows the server keeps track of connected clients.
    void readFromAllConnections()  
    void readFromConnection​(java.lang.String ip)
    Reads data from a connection to an external server.
    void readFromConnection​(processing.net.Client c)  
    void readFromServerClient​(java.lang.String ip)
    Reads data from a client connected to the internal server.
    void readFromServerClient​(processing.net.Client c)  
    void sendToAllServers​(Packet p)
    Sends a packet to all external connections.
    void sendToAllServersExcept​(java.lang.String except, Packet p)
    Sends a packet to all external connections except one (if it is one of this object's external connections).
    void sendToClient​(java.lang.String ip, Packet p)
    Sends a packet to a specific client that is connected to the internal server by ip.
    void sendToClient​(processing.net.Client c, Packet p)  
    void sendToClients​(Packet p)
    Sends a packet to ALL clients connected to the internal server.
    void sendToClientsExcept​(java.lang.String except, Packet p)
    Sends a packet to all connected clients except one.
    void sendToServer​(java.lang.String ip, Packet p)
    Sends a packet to a server if there is a connection to it.
    void sendToServer​(processing.net.Client c, Packet p)  
    void setClientDisconnectAction​(NetAction action)
    Sets an action to be run when an external server disconnects
    void setServerConnectAction​(NetAction action)
    Sets an action to be run when a client connects to the internal server.
    void setServerDisconnectAction​(NetAction action)
    Sets an action to be run when a client disconnects from the internal server.
    void startServer()
    Stops the server if it is running, then starts a new one on the preset server port.
    void startServer​(int port)
    Changes the server port and starts the server on that port.
    void stopServer()
    Stops the server and clears all client data.

  • Method Details

    • getPublicIP

      public java.lang.String getPublicIP()
      Returns the public IP of this device if found using findPublicIP()

    • setServerConnectAction

      public void setServerConnectAction​(NetAction action)
      Sets an action to be run when a client connects to the internal server.
      Parameters:
      action -

    • setServerDisconnectAction

      public void setServerDisconnectAction​(NetAction action)
      Sets an action to be run when a client disconnects from the internal server.
      Parameters:
      action -

    • setClientDisconnectAction

      public void setClientDisconnectAction​(NetAction action)
      Sets an action to be run when an external server disconnects
      Parameters:
      action -

    • putInServerEvent

      public void putInServerEvent​(processing.net.Server ref, processing.net.Client newClient)
      If you want to use the built-in server to its full capacity, put this in the serverEvent() method like this: public void serverEvent(Server s, Client c) { NetIO.putInServerEvent(s, c); } This allows the server keeps track of connected clients.

    • putInClientEvent

      public void putInClientEvent​(processing.net.Client c)
      If you want to use the built-in server and clients to their full capacity, put this in the clientEvent() method like this: public void clientEvent(Client c) { NetIO.putInClientEvent(c); }

    • putInDisconnectEvent

      public void putInDisconnectEvent​(processing.net.Client oldClient)
      If you want to use the built-in server to its full capacity, put this in the disconnectEvent() method like this: public void disconnectEvent(Client c) { NetIO.putInDisconnectEvent(c); } You need to do this to prevent data from being sent to disconnected clients.

    • findPublicIP

      public void findPublicIP()
      Uses http://checkip.amazonaws.com to find this device's public IP address. Can be called in the constructor by putting 'true' as the last argument.

    • addPacketType

      public void addPacketType​(Packet p)
      Adds a type of packet that can be sent over the network. This is needed because the NetworkIO object needs a reference to a Packet to use its construct() method.

    • findFirstInstanceOf

      public <T extends Packet> T findFirstInstanceOf​(T target, java.util.LinkedList<Packet> queue)
      Searches for the first instance of a packet in a client's queue.
      Parameters:
      target -
      queue -
      Returns:
      the first instance of that type of packet in a client's queue

    • pollFirstInstanceOf

      public <T extends Packet> T pollFirstInstanceOf​(T target, java.util.LinkedList<Packet> queue)
      Searches for the first instance of a packet in a client's queue, then removes it.
      Type Parameters:
      T -
      Parameters:
      target -
      queue -
      Returns:
      the first instance of that type of packet in a client's queue

    • getServerClients

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​processing.net.Client> getServerClients()
      Returns all clients currently connected to the internal server associated with their ip. Clients are not returned in any particular order.

    • isServerActive

      public boolean isServerActive()
      Returns true if the internal server is running.

    • isServerClient

      public boolean isServerClient​(processing.net.Client c)
      Returns true if the given client is a client of the internal server.

    • isServerClient

      public boolean isServerClient​(java.lang.String ip)
      Returns true if the given ip is a client of the internal server.

    • startServer

      public void startServer​(int port)
      Changes the server port and starts the server on that port.

    • startServer

      public void startServer()
      Stops the server if it is running, then starts a new one on the preset server port.

    • stopServer

      public void stopServer()
      Stops the server and clears all client data.

    • getServerPort

      public int getServerPort()

    • sendToClients

      public void sendToClients​(Packet p)
      Sends a packet to ALL clients connected to the internal server.

    • sendToClientsExcept

      public void sendToClientsExcept​(java.lang.String except, Packet p)
      Sends a packet to all connected clients except one. This can be used when a client sends data that needs to be distributed to the other connected clients.

    • sendToClient

      public void sendToClient​(java.lang.String ip, Packet p)
      Sends a packet to a specific client that is connected to the internal server by ip. If the ip is found to be in this NetworkIO's external connections, it will write directly to its buffer to avoid circular connections.

    • sendToClient

      public void sendToClient​(processing.net.Client c, Packet p)

    • nextServerClient

      public processing.net.Client nextServerClient()
      Returns the next available client connected to the server with new data. Can return null. Here is a simple way to handle multiple clients' data in the draw loop: for(Client nextClient = NetIO.nextServerClient(); nextClient != null; nextClient = NetIO.nextServerClient()) { NetIO.readFromServerClient(nextClient); }

    • readFromServerClient

      public void readFromServerClient​(java.lang.String ip)
      Reads data from a client connected to the internal server. Complete packets are stored in the client's associated queue.

    • readFromServerClient

      public void readFromServerClient​(processing.net.Client c)

    • getServerClientData

      public java.util.LinkedList<Packet> getServerClientData​(java.lang.String ip)
      Returns the queue of received packets associated with a client connected to the internal server. If the ip or client does not match any connected clients or is null, an empty queue is returned.

    • getServerClientData

      public java.util.LinkedList<Packet> getServerClientData​(processing.net.Client c)

    • getAllServerClientData

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.LinkedList<Packet>> getAllServerClientData()
      Returns a Map of all queues associated with ips.

    • getConnections

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​processing.net.Client> getConnections()
      Returns all external connections.

    • hasConnection

      public boolean hasConnection()
      Returns true if connected to any external server.

    • hasConnection

      public boolean hasConnection​(java.lang.String ip)
      Returns true if connected to external server with the provided ip.

    • hasConnection

      public boolean hasConnection​(processing.net.Client c)

    • connectToServer

      public boolean connectToServer​(java.lang.String ip, int port)
      Attempts to connect to a server. Returns true if the connection was successful. Clears client data if client was already connected to the server.
      Note: Connecting to Server.ip() will likely change the ip to 127.0.0.1 (localhost) to prevent circular connections.

    • disconnectFromServer

      public void disconnectFromServer​(java.lang.String ip)

    • disconnectFromAllServers

      public void disconnectFromAllServers()

    • sendToServer

      public void sendToServer​(java.lang.String ip, Packet p)
      Sends a packet to a server if there is a connection to it. If the server is found to be part of this object, write directly to avoid circular connections.

    • sendToServer

      public void sendToServer​(processing.net.Client c, Packet p)

    • sendToAllServers

      public void sendToAllServers​(Packet p)
      Sends a packet to all external connections.
      Parameters:
      p -

    • sendToAllServersExcept

      public void sendToAllServersExcept​(java.lang.String except, Packet p)
      Sends a packet to all external connections except one (if it is one of this object's external connections). This is useful for distributing data to other servers after receiving data from one.
      Parameters:
      except -
      p -

    • readFromConnection

      public void readFromConnection​(java.lang.String ip)
      Reads data from a connection to an external server. Complete packets are stored in the connection's queue.

    • readFromConnection

      public void readFromConnection​(processing.net.Client c)

    • readFromAllConnections

      public void readFromAllConnections()

    • getConnectionData

      public java.util.LinkedList<Packet> getConnectionData​(java.lang.String ip)
      Returns the queue of received packets associated with a connection to an external server. If the ip or client does not match any connections or is null, an empty queue is returned.

    • getConnectionData

      public java.util.LinkedList<Packet> getConnectionData​(processing.net.Client c)

    • getAllConnectionData

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.LinkedList<Packet>> getAllConnectionData()
      Returns a Map of all queues associated with external connections and their IP's

    • isLocalHost

      public boolean isLocalHost​(java.lang.String ip)
